skill.name: marp-slide
skill.description: Create professional Marp presentation slides with 7 beautiful themes (default, minimal, colorful, dark, gradient, tech, business). Use when users request slide creation, presentations, or Marp documents. Supports custom themes, image layouts, and "make it look good" requests with automatic quality improvements.
skill.summary: Create professional Marp presentation slides with 7 beautiful themes, automatic quality improvements, and best practice templates.
skill.author: softaworks

security_audit.summary: All 571 static findings are FALSE POSITIVEs. The skill contains only documentation and Markdown templates with embedded CSS themes. No executable code exists. The 'critical' heuristic alert was triggered by legitimate documentation patterns (code examples with URLs and environment variables), not actual malicious behavior.

content.user_title: Create professional presentation slides with Marp
content.value_statement: Creating presentation slides manually is time-consuming and often results in inconsistent design. This skill provides 7 pre-designed Marp themes with built-in best practices for automatic slide creation, quality improvements, and professional styling.
actual_capabilities: Creates presentation slides using Marp Markdown format with 7 pre-designed themes
Applies automatic quality improvements including concise titles and bullet point formatting
Handles vague requests like "make it look good" by inferring appropriate themes
Integrates images using Marp official image syntax with background and layout options
Saves output files to the designated outputs directory with proper extensions
limitations: Outputs only Marp Markdown files, requires Marp renderer for PDF/HTML conversion
Does not support real-time collaboration or live preview
Depends on external Marp CLI or VS Code extension for final rendering
Limited to the 7 pre-installed themes and CSS customization requires separate CSS knowledge

use_cases.title: Quick Presentation Creation
use_cases.description: Users need to create a presentation quickly from content outlines. The skill selects an appropriate theme, applies best practices, and generates professional slides.
use_cases.target_user: Business professionals, educators, and anyone needing quick slide decks

use_cases.title: Automated Slide Enhancement
use_cases.description: Users have rough slide content and want to improve its quality. The skill shortens titles, optimizes bullet points, and adds visual hierarchy automatically.
use_cases.target_user: Content creators, trainers, and presenters refining their materials

use_cases.title: Documentation to Slides Conversion
use_cases.description: Users want to convert existing documentation or meeting notes into presentation format. The skill structures content into slide-appropriate chunks.
use_cases.target_user: Technical writers, project managers, and meeting facilitators

prompt_templates.title: Basic Slide Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a presentation about [topic] using the marp-slide skill. Use the [theme] theme if specified, or choose an appropriate theme based on the content.
prompt_templates.scenario: When users ask for slides without detailed specifications

prompt_templates.title: Theme-Specific Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Create Marp slides for [content] using the [business/tech/minimal/colorful/dark/gradient/default] theme. Include [number] slides covering [topics].
prompt_templates.scenario: When users specify a particular theme or content requirements

prompt_templates.title: Make It Look Good Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Make these slides look good: [paste content or describe content]. Use the marp-slide skill to apply best practices and select an appropriate theme automatically.
prompt_templates.scenario: When users give vague quality improvement requests

prompt_templates.title: Image Integration Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a presentation with images using the marp-slide skill. Include [describe images and their placement]. Use the official Marp image syntax for background and layout.
prompt_templates.scenario: When users need slides with integrated images

best_practices: Start by reading the documentation files (references/marp-syntax.md, references/best-practices.md) before creating slides
Choose the theme based on content type: tech for developer content, business for corporate, colorful for creative, minimal for academic
Follow the quality guidelines: 5-7 character titles, 3-5 bullet points per slide, adequate whitespace
anti_patterns: Do not create slides without first reading the relevant reference documentation for syntax and best practices
Avoid using overly long titles or dense text blocks that exceed 15-25 characters per line
Do not save output files outside the designated /mnt/user-data/outputs/ directory

faq.question: What themes are available?
faq.answer: Seven themes are available: default (clean beige), minimal (white/gray), colorful (pink gradient), dark (black with cyan/purple), gradient (multi-color), tech (GitHub-style dark), and business (corporate navy).

faq.question: How do I choose the right theme?
faq.answer: Match the theme to your content: tech for developer content, business for corporate presentations, colorful for creative events, minimal for academic talks, and dark/tech for evening presentations or tech meetups.

faq.question: Can I add images to my slides?
faq.answer: Yes, use the official Marp image syntax: ![bg right:40%](image.png) for side images, ![bg](image.png) for full backgrounds, and ![w:600px](image.png) for sized images.

faq.question: Where are the output files saved?
faq.answer: All presentation files are saved to /mnt/user-data/outputs/ with a .md extension. These are Marp Markdown files that can be rendered to PDF, HTML, or PPTX using Marp tools.

faq.question: How do I handle vague requests like "make it look good"?
faq.answer: The skill automatically infers the appropriate theme from the content context, applies best practices (short titles, bullet points, whitespace), and enhances visual hierarchy without requiring explicit instructions.

faq.question: What file formats does the skill output?
faq.answer: The skill outputs Marp Markdown (.md) files. To convert to PDF, HTML, or PPTX, use the Marp CLI (marp-cli) or the Marp VS Code extension.
